nodes.bodyText: Please add JavaDocs to this new Class
Please update these JavaDocs to better describe this new HttpHeadersInitializer.  These old JavaDocs are incorrect & accidentally carried over from the old class.
Please remove this TODO & add JavaDocs to this method (as this is one of the primary methods in this class).

Should this have a new issue ticket?  It sounds like you are recommending upgrading to Spring v5.2.9?  While we don't need to do that in this PR, we could take this opportunity to recommend an upgrade to Spring & Spring Boot if there's a good reason to do so.

@tdonohue-> (Heads up: it's been a while since we altered this and we seemed to have forgotten to take note of WHY exactly this was commented out)
One of the points mentioned in release tag v5.2.9 contains an issue related to the response.reset call, which seems to fit the description (And also jogged Raf's memory)
That being said:

The current spring versions seems 5.2.5 (which is released in march, around 8 months ago.)
The last 5.2.x version is 5.2.11, which is only a week old.
There are 2 courses that we can take imo

We upgrade it early to both get the advantage of all fixes that have been done up to now, as well as already getting a bunch of the upgrade done. (Upgrading later on might introduce MORE changes required). This DOES introduce the need for later upgrades as well if in the meantime, a big bug fix is released.
We wait until there is a more convenient time for this upgrade (less features/fixes in the making for example), and we upgrade then. That way, we only do one BIG upgrade at that time, instead of multiple smaller ones

@tdonohue , sorry for the confusion. I seemed to have linked to an incorrect issue previously.
This code does the following:

Clears any data that exists in the buffer as well as the status code, headers.

I have reconvened with @Raf-atmire, who did the actual implementation of this upgrade.
During this implementation, this line of the code broke the feature when it was being triggered, so it was put in a comment temporarily.
(We do not actually see any risks with leaving this line out for the time being, so we can reduce the complication of this ticket, and holding it back because of a spring upgrade)
I have now re-enabled this line locally, and went through a quick test of downloading a content file created through the script processing, and this does NOT break the code anymore.
As such, I have re-enabled this line again.
If, during your testing, you see any issue with this come up, please let me know so we can indeed check if this is required for the time being or not.

As such -> This was the underlying reason that it was commented out temporarily.
If you agree with this Tim, I'd propose to leave this response.reset as is for now (Commenting it out again), and follow it up later on

@jonas-atmire : Thanks for the more thorough testing/explanation.  I'm OK with leaving this commented out for now... if you and @Raf-atmire feel that the ideal behavior is that this response.reset() should be enabled, then I'd ask that we please create an issue ticket about re-enabling it once we upgrade to Spring v5.2.9 or above.  That way you can link/reference the ticket in your comment and say something like //TODO response.reset => Can be re-instated once we upgrade to Spring 5.2.9, see issue #__
That seems good enough to me. I'd just ask that we create a ticket as a reminder, as the TODO may end up forgotten otherwise.   I'll likely schedule the Spring upgrade for 7.1 or 7.2 since it seems low priority at this time.  Thanks!
Please add JavaDocs to this public method.  (I realize this method was copied over from the old class, but this is a good opportunity to describe it better with JavaDocs, if possible)
